This freedom and gallantry toward young ladies is not 
                                                                           157
the outgrowth of a tender, Christlike sympathy. . . . If you look upon these matters as unworthy of mention, you will repeat them. Investigate your past life, and let moral taste be created by a purification of the soul temple. Put away your excuses, for you have none. Your ideas need a moral renovation, and then you will see things in a different light. God calls for men to do this work who are pure in heart and undefiled in thought, having an eye single to His glory. . . .
